questions.question: ‘I can’t swim.’ ‘………………………. can I.’
questions.description: After a negative statement, we can add another negative statement to it using neither.

questions.question: She is ………………………….. beautiful.
questions.description: Too is not possible here it shows negative extremes.

questions.question: We started early so that we ……………………………… there before noon.
questions.description: When the main clause is in the past tense, might and would are common after so that.

questions.question: I waited for ……………………………. two hours, but he didn’t come.
questions.description: Another can be used with plural expressions of quantity.

questions.question: I visit my grandparents ………………………….. two weeks.
questions.description: Every can be used before plural expressions in measurements of frequency.

questions.question: Have you got a lot of ……………………………….?
questions.description: Luggage does not have a plural form.

questions.question: My dad and mom …………………………………. me to be a scientist.
questions.description: When we connect two singular subjects with and, the verb is plural.

questions.question: The Prime Minister as well as his cabinet ministers ……………………………. to increase spending on defense.
questions.description: When we connect two nouns with as well as, the verb agrees with the former noun.

questions.question: The woman along with her husband ………………………………… in the lobby.
questions.description: When we connect two nouns with along with, the verb agrees with the former.

questions.question: You and I ……………………………… good friends.
questions.description: When we connect two pronouns with and, the verb should be plural.

questions.question: It is time you ............................... a job.
questions.description: Use a simple past after it is time.
